blog.name: ao3feed-starwars
blog.title: Star Wars AO3 Feed
blog.description:
An AO3 Feed for the Star Wars - All Media Types tag.

Icon from the Star Wars App.

title: Desert Magic
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2Gy2ylG

by Anonymous

He was hungry, always so hungry. He sweated through the sheets when he dreamed of the desert sun. Shivered under piles of blanket when the sand was lit only by the moons. He tried to magic up an apple, a glass of cool water but the lifeforce around him was so dim that the simple charm wasted away in the desert sand.

The dreams saved him.

Words: 4576, Chapters: ½, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Star Wars - All Media Types, Star Wars Sequel Trilogy
  • Rating: Teen And Up Audiences
  • Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply
  • Categories: F/M
  • Characters: Rey (Star Wars), Finn (Star Wars), Ben Solo | Kylo Ren, Rose Tico, Luke Skywalker, Anakin Skywalker | Darth Vader, Leia Organa, Han Solo, Sheev Palpatine | Darth Sidious
  • Relationships: Kylo Ren/Rey, Rey/Ben Solo
  • Additional Tags: Alternate Universe - Canon Divergence, Alternate Universe - Fantasy, Smaller age gap because I say so


read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2Gy2ylG

blog.name: mithrilroses
blog.title: Regan
blog.description:
17 ♀| 🏳️‍🌈

Weird fandom & personal shit. I have actual content somewhere, I promise.

(Maybe. Hopefully.)

| Art/Stories- @fallennsparrow |

| Poetry/Prose- @ofstarlightandashes |

summary: 🖊 for asheli (if it hasn’t been asked it??)
question: 🖊 for asheli (if it hasn’t been asked it??)
answer:
Thank you!! ✨ I’m always ready to ramble on about my problematic fav ™


.

Before she falls, her favorite color is red. Red like the bright streaks of a sunset, red like her love for Katyan and Malak, red like the soft glow of a Sith lightsaber. It’s the heart of a fire that burns too hot, too bright, that crumbles to ash too quickly… leaving behind only the embers. Red is power and passion and all of her heart’s desires, but most of all red is Revan.


Then her memories are wiped- and later, as they begin to return, Asheli remembers this. And yet she is not the same woman she once was, not the Jedi nor the Sith Lord nor the Prodigal Knight they’re making her out to be now, but something new. Something different.


And so she picks a different color.


Now she adores the pale spring green of new life, of new beginnings. Ash has never been one for plants, but she tries. It’s nice to keep something alive for once, and the feeling of dirt between her fingers grounds her. It is the green of new growth on Dxun when she settles down with Canderous, the green of the jungle and all of its inspiration and secrets and mysteries that some day she will unlock. It’s the soft shade of a Jedi Healer, which she will never be but in her dreams, but it’s a nice thing to aspire to she supposes.


Yet most of all, green is a peaceful color.


(Given the circumstances, she thinks it’s an appropriate choice.)

blog.name: alexander-wirt
blog.title: Kimmy G.
blog.description: 20-year old young woman who likes Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (mainly 2012 and Rise of the TMNT), Steven Universe, Over the Garden Wall and more. Alex is my TMNT OC and my cinnamon roll, and Wirt is my vanilla bean.

body:
SWR Episode 20+21 Review

Man, was this one a roller coaster. Tam choosing to side with the First Order, Kaz and Torra teaming up again, Neeku being whacky and productive. These two episodes had it all! I can’t wait for Season 2! And yes, I did notice Rucklin in the background in Part 1. 😂

reblog.comment:
